incidents.name: SurveyMonkey app crashing for some iOS users

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved. The full fix was implemented days ago and we monitored for a few days to ensure that there aren't any remaining issues that would resurface.
A full fix for the issue has been released. We are currently monitoring before calling the issue as fully resolved.

A partial fix was released, which should resolve most of the crash issue. There still may be some residual issues with our SurveyMonkey iOS app. Our team is still working on a full fix so any remaining issues should get resolved with the full fix.
The issue has been identified. The issue affects the SurveyMonkey iOS app (not the SurveyMonkey Anywhere iOS app) for some iOS users. We are working on a fix.

incidents.name: Create and Summary pages showing "Looks like we slipped" error

incident_updates.body:
Between 12:57 PM and 1:37 PM PST the Create and Summary pages were showing a "Looks like we slipped" error for some users. 

The issue has been resolved and the error message should no longer be displaying on these pages.

incidents.name: Issue with newly created surveys and collector weblinks.

incident_updates.body: This incident is now resolved.

We are currently investigating an issue where newly created surveys are not showing in the My Surveys and Dashboards pages. Also newly created weblink are showing 404 errors. Our team is hard at work on getting everything back up to speed, and things should be back to normal soon. We apologize for the inconvenience.

incidents.name: Errors when accessing the SurveyMonkey site

incident_updates.body: Errors were observed when accessing the SurveyMonkey site from approximately 11:00AM-11:20AM PST today. The issue is now resolved and all users should be able to access the site again.

We've since resolved the issue which delayed the latest survey responses from appearing in Analyze Results. The cause of file upload exports failing has also been identified and we're working on a fix for that now.

This incident has been resolved. Outbound messages should now be sent and delivered successfully.

We have isolated the root cause of the issue, and are now seeing outbound messages being delivered. However, there still may be delays to delivery of all queued messages. We are continuing to monitor the issue.
Outbound message delivery has resumed but it will take time for all queued messages to be delivered. We are continuing to monitor this issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue and making progress on identifying root cause and fixing the issue - outbound message delivery has resumed but it is not yet fully operational.
We are continuing to investigate this issue, and will provide further updates.
⚠️ We're aware of an issue impacting outbound emails not being delivered for US based customers, and we are investigating the cause.

We are investigating an issue where custom weblink subdomains are showing a 404 error. Our team is hard at work on getting everything back up to speed, and things should be back to normal soon. I apologize for the inconvenience.
